moves.1. d4: this is awful.  again with the gruenfeld ideas but be warned this isn't pretty
moves.2... g6 3. e4 d5 4. e5 Ne4 5. Qd3: at this point, probably better to play Bf5 and cover the N and develop the B.
moves.5... Nxf2: I get carried away with forks that force the K to move and prevent castling
moves.7. Qb5+ Nd7 8. Qxb7: bringing the B back might have been better but boy those b7 pawns attract Qs like flies to excrement
moves.8... Bxc2 9. Bg5: this is a price for not developing properly.  i resist f6 because I like castling over there, but Nb6 wasn't the response
moves.9... Nb6 10. Bb5+: now, I'm stuck.  no initiative, down in points.  the B can't help because it just HAD to go pawn-grabbin.
moves.11... Rc8: better to play Bg7?  there's a N fork looming, and that's not the least of the troubles
moves.12. Rc1 Be4 13. Rxc7 Bxd5: the B gets into the action but  with the other three--no four--pieces, it makes no difference.  the game is lost
moves.14. Bxd7+ Qxd7 15. Rxc8+ Qd8 16. Qb5+ Bc: the only move but better refered to as a delay.
moves.17. Qxc6#: I look at this game when I feel too confident.  poor opening play can bring the reaper within twenty moves.  the opponent's name should have warned me..
